title: A Feast for Crows (A Song of Ice and Fire, Book 4)

highlights.text: “The day you make them all is the day you stop improving.”
Words are like arrows, Arianne. Once loosed, you cannot call them back.
“A Hand without a hand? A bad jape, sister. Don’t ask me to rule.”
“You won’t try. You will obey.”
Too many dragons are as dangerous as too few,
“Knowledge is a weapon, Jon. Arm yourself well before you ride forth to battle.”
Lord Tywin wore no crown, yet he was all a king should be.”
Friend or foe, the crows care not.
history is a wheel, for the nature of man is fundamentally unchanging. What has happened before will perforce happen again,
“I prefer my history dead. Dead history is writ in ink, the living sort in blood.”
“When a dog goes bad, the fault lies with his master,”
We men are so weak. Our bodies betray even the noblest of us.
We Dornish are a hot-blooded people, quick to anger and slow to forgive.
only madmen fight wars they cannot win.”
“There have always been men who found it easier to speak vows than to keep them,”
“It does no good to speak of things no man can change.”
“Trust is earned. Like gold.”
“A man does not need to be a wizard to know truth from falsehood, not if he has eyes.
“No mother should outlive her children, and no captain should outlive his ship.”
what a man can do and what a man will do are two different things,
A lion may be fierce enough on land, but at sea the kraken rules supreme.”
Live a thrall or die a king.
“If I tell Robert, mayhaps he’ll make me Lord of Darry,”
Boys are the cruelest creatures on the earth.
“If I pray nicely, will the Father give me a new hand?”
“A lion shouldn’t have horns.
“The brave man slays with a sword, the craven with a wineskin. We are both kingslayers, ser.”

He served, but found no pride in service. He fought, but took no joy in victory. He drank, to drown his pain in a sea of wine. He did not love, nor was he loved himself. It was hate that drove him. Though he committed many sins, he never sought forgiveness. Where other men dream of love, or wealth, or glory, this man Sandor Clegane dreamed of slaying his own brother, a sin so terrible it makes me shudder just to speak of it. Yet that was the bread that nourished him, the fuel that kept his fires burning. Ignoble as it was, the hope of seeing his brother’s blood upon his blade was all this sad and angry creature lived for . . . and even that was taken from him, when Prince Oberyn of Dorne stabbed Ser Gregor with a poisoned spear.”
“Why does a man with one pot of gold need another? Men are greedy.
Better to mock the game than to play and lose.
some stupid lady throwing herself off some stupid tower because her stupid prince was dead.
The lady should go kill the ones who killed her prince. And the singer should be on the Wall.
Dragons are neither male nor female,
On the gallows tree, all men are brothers.
Valor is a poor substitute for numbers.
How much do we men ever know?
“We all dream of things we cannot have.
